page.title: 07NAIRN:GOLF CLUB
page.content: Nairn Golf Club started as a gentlemens'club in 1887. No ladies were allowed in the clubhouse unless the temperature fell below -3'C. There are two courses: an 18 hole,par 72 (6540 yards)and a 9 hole course called the Newton. The course attracts 5000{visitors and more than 1000 members who each pay Â£100 each year. The course has had a few major {tournaments}e.g. the British Ladies Amateur Tournament and the Mens Scottish Amateur Trophy. The Northern Open is being held here in its centenery year 1986. The pro-shop sells mainly balls and putters selling 4-5 dozen balls daily. The main problem with the course is that the{sea}is slowly{eroding}it. {Coastal protection}has already been done but there is still a danger.
